newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian silver down at close, gold firm.
newsitem.headline: Indian silver down at close, gold firm.

text.p: Silver prices opened on a weak note and extended losses towards the close on higher supplies of imported metal on Wednesday, dealers said.
Silver was up by 10 rupees per kg on Tuesday.
"The weak trend in the world market also prompted scattered profit-taking," a dealer said.
"Sentiment remained subdued at the close as traders expect more inflow in the coming days," another broker said.
"Gold, on the other hand, remained firm during the day on seasonal support and shortage of ready stock," he added.
Prices of gold biscuits (116.50 gramme) settled 100 rupees higher at 60,600 rupees per piece.
The Bombay bullion market will officially be closed on Thursday to mark the birth anniversary of the Hindu god Krishna. The market will reopen for trading on Friday, dealers said.
